intro: Hieracium crenatifolium, commonly known as the scalloped hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with basal leaves that are deeply lobed and scalloped in appearance. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium crenatifolium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed sites, and it is known for its ornamental value as well as its role in supporting pollinators.
